thread.title: Ryan Says GOP Will Not Let Health Care Overhaul End Here
thread.title_full: Ryan Says GOP Will Not Let Health Care Overhaul End Here

author: Jack Davis
title: Ryan Says GOP Will Not Let Health Care Overhaul End Here

organizations.name: gop will not let health care overhaul end here ryan says gop will not let health care overhaul

text:
Ryan Says GOP Will Not Let Health Care Overhaul End Here "We are going to keep getting at this thing." by Jack Davis March 28, 2017 at 10:23am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
In the wake of Friday’s meltdown of the House Republican attempt to overhaul Obamacare, House Speaker Paul Ryan , R-Wis., said Tuesday that he believes the pieces of a deal to replace the health care law can be put together into legislation that will pass. 
“We are going to work together and listen together until we get this right,” Ryan said following a GOP conference meeting. 
Although Friday’s failure highlighted the divisions between moderates and conservatives, Ryan said Tuesday that House Republicans were “united around our agenda” and that replacing Obamacare remains on that agenda. Advertisement - story continues below President Trump Takes Major Steps Towards Reducing Federal Overreach, Signs Four Resolutions Returning State Power 
“It is just too important,” he said. “Obamacare is a collapsing law doing too much damage to families.” 
Ryan did not speak about details, but said the GOP remains committed to the concept that “everyone can have access to affordable coverage.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Ryan, who has portrayed Friday’s failure as part of the transition from a party of opposition to a party of governing, said Tuesday’s meeting was a positive step. 
“We’re not going to retrench into our corners,” he said. “Today we broke down many of our dividing lines.” 
Ryan’s public comments mirrored those he told donors Monday. 
“We are going to keep getting at this thing,” he said, according to a recording of a call between Ryan and GOP donors obtained by The Washington Post . “We’re not going to just all of a sudden abandon health care and move on to the rest. We are going to move on with rest of our agenda, keep that on track, while we work the health care problem.” Advertisement - story continues below Top Senate Democrat Cool To Filibustering Gorsuch’s Nomination 
“We still have a promise to keep, so the speaker wants members to continue discussing this issue until we can find a path ahead,” Doug Andres, a spokesman for Ryan, later added. 
President Donald Trump has indicated that, for the time being, he will move on to other issues and leave health care alone until, as he said, Obamacare “explodes.” 
“As you know, I’ve been saying for years that the best thing is to let Obamacare explode and then go make a deal with the Democrats and have one unified deal. And they will come to us; we won’t have to come to them,” he told The Washington Post. “So when it explodes, they come to us, and we make one beautiful deal for the people.” 
Trump said members of the conservative House Freedom Caucus, who opposed the bill, “made a mistake, but that’s OK.” 
Trump was asked whether he though a bipartisan package might be easier than brining conservative Republicans into the fold. 
“A lot of people might say that,” Trump said, laughing. “We’ll end up with a better health-care plan. A great plan. And you wouldn’t need the Freedom Caucus.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Suggest a correction Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Popular Right Now
